intro: Avenastrum adzharicum, commonly known as the Caucasian wild oat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Avenastrum adzharicum is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
